Jayson can introduce you to 11 people at AbeBooks, an Amazon company
Jayson worked at AbeBooks, an Amazon company

--= Analyzing the Experience of the "Collective"​ =--At Collokia, we analyze the collective experience of software developers, devops, sysadmins, and other IT workers to help eliminate repeated mistakes, accelerate learning, to better leverage unknown skills, and to connect people who can help each other. In other words, we quietly learn from their behaviour and then "Augment their Reality"​ by overlaying information directly onto their natural work environment. Some of the technologies we use to accomplish this, include: ▫ NLP (JVM toolkits) ▫ Machine Learning (JVM toolkits) ▫ Data Engineering and Data Science (Apache Spark, Apache Flink, Azure DataLake/Analytics, Kinesis, Presto) ▫ DevOps (AWS, Azure, Docker, Terraform) ▫ Front-end (EcmaScript 6, Typescript, Aurelia, Foundation) ▫ Back-end (Kotlin with Vert.x 3, ElasticSearch, Apache Ignite, many AWS services) ▫ Plugin development for Eclipse, IntelliJ, Netbeans, VisualStudio▫ Plugin development for Gradle, Maven, Ant, SBT, TeamCity, Jenkins, Bamboo, etc. Everything we do is at scale, there is no "small"​ version of our data and definitely no "we will fix it later."

Expert level Data Engineering, Data Lake, Ingestion, and Search/Analytics systems for some of the top companies in the world:Renaissance LearningP&GGlobantEBSCOGradle Inc.Using custom and open-source technologies at all scales -- centered around Apache Spark, Elasticsearch, Solr, Kafka, NiFi, Streamsets, and many elements in the Hadoop ecosystem.  Targeting on-premise and cloud environments taking advantage of cloud native services as appropriate (AWS and Azure).
Contract helping key companies assess and hire their top-tier of engineering talent.

Building Open-source projects related to:▫  Infrastructure-as-code (Kohesive-iac)▫  Elasticsearch (data import handle, Elasticsearch-lang-Kotlin)-------               https://github.com/kohesive/elasticsearch-data-import-handler-------               https://github.com/kohesive/keplin▫  Kotlin (Kovert, Klutter, Keplin, Jackson)-------              https://github.com/kohesive-------              https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-module-kotlin▫  Solr (Solr-Undertow)  -------              https://github.com/kohesive/solr-undertow

Search, Big Data, Massive Scale, Batch and Stream processing, NoSQL and Graph data, and Cloud technology -- consulting, intellectual property development and investments. Clients have included:Renaissance Learning ▫ Prezi ▫ ProQuest ▫ SerialsSolutions ▫ Plum Analytics (EBSCO) ▫ SitterCity ▫ UrtheCast ▫ SheetMusicPlus ▫ Quandl ▫ TIM Group ▫ Decooda ▫ Exclaim ▫ Aptus ▫ Endeca ▫ Boeing ▫ AbeBooks (Amazon) ▫ Alibris ▫ LibraryThing ▫ Exclaim ▫ Zend Technologies ▫ Unfuddle ▫ Gossamer Threads ▫ OpriusWe work with, and contribute to Solr, ElasticSearch, Kotlin and other open source projects.  See our high performance solr-undertow server: https://github.com/bremeld/solr-undertow

Jayson is a strong leader and a powerful presence on any team he's involved with. He embodies all the qualities you want to have in a leader and technical architect - he thinks strategically and focuses on the big picture, but can still roll up his sleeves and get down into the trenches on day-to-day practical issues. I've worked under Jayson twice now at different organizations, and have always respected his direct, no-nonsense approach to problems. If you have real tech challenges to solve, you want Jayson on your team.

December 9, 2012, Jayson worked with Kazuaki in the same group

Having worked with Jayson on the Summon development team, I have been extremely impressed by the range of Jayson's technical skills, technical leadership skills and his attitude toward solving tough problems.   Not only did Jayson serve as the first principal architect of Summon, creating a prototype and designing the essential technologies of the product, but he also put together talented specialists through his broad personal connections to form a core of the development team.  As an exceptionally talented developer himself, Jayson understands developers' minds, and advocates for what works best for the team -- simply put, he knows how to lead a team.I can attest to his skills on search technologies, Java, web applications, database technologies, latest software development tools, to name just a few.  But most importantly, he has the ability to see the whole picture from both a business perspective and a technology perspective, as well as the ability to understand technical details.  Jayson understood the technical details of nearly every component of the product, and when urgent issues occurred, he would dive right in to fix them.  Combined with his keen sense of personal accountability and responsibility, he is a rare resource who can solve the toughest software engineering problems, both as a leader and a developer.I would give my highest recommendation for Jayson for any software development projects, whether it be a technology leadership position, an architect position, or a consulting role.   In particular, I believe any companies that have fast-paced, challenging and ambitious goals in search technologies will be extremely happy to have him as a resource.

summary: [[ Hot topics:  CTO,  Data Engineering , Cloud / IaC, Search / Query Understanding, Kotlin ]]  I am a senior resource that brings together the technology and business worlds. I have a range of experience from small software companies and Internet startups to large global software and internet companies. I have a reputation for going after the tough tasks, the hard goals, and accomplishing what the business needs to thrive. Specialties: Search -- small to massive scale (billions+) and complex search systems in ElasticSearch and Solr. Including linguistics, NLP, relevancy algorithms, data pipelines, metadata searching,  RDF and open-data, semantic analysis, disambiguation, predicting/recommendations.Data Engineering -- ingesting and crunching data at Massive Scale. Data ingestion and data movement, data processing patterns at scale. Application scalability and performance and near real time use of big data. Cloud -- Wall to wall experience in Amazon AWS, getting there in Azure, and a touch of Google Cloud.Emerging technologist -- Working with cutting edge open-source.  Also in furthering the development and success of the Kotlin language for the JVM.
name: Jayson Minard
title: Technology Miracles
